snippet: The British Ministry of Defense has notified residents of some buildings that it might install air-defense systems on roofs to protect the Olympics.
abstract: British Ministry of Defense is notifying residents of some London buildings that it might install air-defense systems on rooftops to protect the city during the Summer Olympics; those systems are only one piece of a broad program to keep the Olympic Park, with its proximity to residential areas, safe from attacks; some experts question the wisdom of using a missile-defense system in densely populated areas.
lead_paragraph: The British Ministry of Defense has notified residents of some buildings that it might install air-defense systems on roofs to protect the Olympics.

headline.seo: London Wary of Rooftop Missiles Plan During Olympics
headline.main: A New Amenity May Show Up on Some London Roofs for the Olympics: Missiles
headline.print_headline: A New Amenity May Show Up on Some London Roofs for the Olympics: Missiles
